title: Darkstream: the war on Trump
author: VD
content_html:
I’ll be doing a Darkstream tonight at 8 PM to discuss the judicial and media wars on the God-Emperor.

UPDATE: The replay is here. It is apparent to me that the new opposition media Narrative is “President Bannon”, which they are hoping will cause a split between Bannon and Trump, and thereby inspire the God-Emperor to fire his most effective strategist and the presidential advisor whom they fear most.


“For the moment, Mr. Bannon remains the president’s dominant adviser,” The Times wrote in its piece on Sunday, “despite Mr. Trump’s anger that he was not fully briefed on details of the executive order he signed giving his chief strategist a seat on the National Security Council, a greater source of frustration to the president than the fallout from the travel ban.”


Former Secretary of State Madeleine Albright, who served in the Clinton administration, said on CNN on Sunday that she thought Bannon was “the person that’s pulling the strings.”


The Washington Post reported on Saturday that Trump had noticed Bannon’s rising media profile, and MSNBC’s “Morning Joe” host Joe Scarborough questioned whether Bannon was “calling the shots” on Monday, comments that seemed to incite Trump to tweet that that wasn’t the case.


It’s the new oppomedia Narrative. They’ll drop it as soon as it becomes apparent that it isn’t working and Trump isn’t going to fire or demote Bannon.
content_text:
I’ll be doing a Darkstream tonight at 8 PM to discuss the judicial and media wars on the God-Emperor.
UPDATE: The replay
is here
. It is apparent to me that the new opposition media Narrative is “President Bannon”, which they are hoping will cause a split between Bannon and Trump, and thereby inspire the God-Emperor to fire his most effective strategist and the presidential advisor whom they fear most.
“For the moment, Mr. Bannon remains the president’s dominant adviser,” The Times wrote in its piece on Sunday, “despite Mr. Trump’s anger that he was not fully briefed on details of the executive order he signed giving his chief strategist a seat on the National Security Council, a greater source of frustration to the president than the fallout from the travel ban.”
Former Secretary of State Madeleine Albright, who served in the Clinton administration, said on CNN on Sunday that she thought Bannon was “the person that’s pulling the strings.”
The Washington Post reported on Saturday that Trump had noticed Bannon’s rising media profile, and MSNBC’s “Morning Joe” host Joe Scarborough questioned whether Bannon was “calling the shots” on Monday, comments that seemed to incite Trump to tweet that that wasn’t the case.
It’s the new oppomedia Narrative. They’ll drop it as soon as it becomes apparent that it isn’t working and Trump isn’t going to fire or demote Bannon.
